page.title: 16Upper Bush-Barrowhill House
page.content: Upper Bush is a peacful cul-de-sac surrounded by fields and woodland. Once it was a hamlet of over 20 houses but now only 6 remain, 4 of these being over 300 years old. The oldest, Barrowhill House, a yeoman farmer's house built in 1390, is owned by Mr & Mrs Knott. When they bought the property, 21 years ago, it had been turned into 3 farm workers' cottages which had become derelict and had been condemned by Rochester Council. Realising the age of the property Mr Knott, a member of the legal profession, bought & restored it, and today this lovely, oak beamed house has every modern comfort as well as old world charm. Mr Knott enjoys living in this quiet spot and would not like to see it change in any way. They & others of the hamlet have successfully fought building plans.
